answers.answer: Dear NinerK,It is definitely possible that eye problems can be related to your irregular heart beat.  I would recommend that you seek the care of an internist and retinal specialist and have them communicate about your specific situation.Dr. FeldmanSandy T. Feldman, M.D., M.S.ClearView Eye and Laser Medical CenterSan Diego, California

question: Dear Doctor:I have symptomatic retina detachment and have been diagnosed a year a a half ago.  Two weeks ago I have another happening and went to my Retina Specialist.  He told me he thinks that I will have a detachment within 2 months.  I don't have diabetes, but am concerned that the reason why my retinas are so thin is because oxygen is not sufficient.  I haven't discussed this with him.  My blood pressure is really low, 100/59 was the last reading.  I did have a blood pressure of 117/80 about 3 months ago.  I sometimes have irregular heartbeats and palpatations.  My Carbon Dioxide levels in my blood have risen from around 24 to now the highest normal level.  I'm concerned that oxygen is not getting to my eyes or my brain.  Am I on the right track or way off base?  I asked my doctor about the levels and he didn't seem concerned, but don't these all tie into the other?
title: Eye problem caused by defective heart?
